{"step_by_step_thinking": "Primary teeth, also known as baby teeth, are temporary and eventually fall out to make way for permanent, secondary teeth. This process involves the resorption of the primary tooth's root, which is replaced by the growing secondary tooth. Therefore, primary roots do indeed resorb more easily than secondary roots. The other options are not necessarily true. The number of accessory and lateral canals can vary greatly between individuals and teeth, and primary roots are not necessarily shorter than secondary roots.", "answer_choice": "B. Primary roots resorb more easily"}
